title: Ticket #1251: Kbdd ignored by default on linux
description:
The kbdd's reports of console activity are completely ignored by the startd when calculating ConsoleIdle if the CONSOLE_DEVICES config param contains any valid devices. The config file we distribute for linux sets CONSOLE_DEVICS to "mouse, console". On my CSL desktop, /dev/console is a valid device whose atime isn't updated (the reason we use the kbdd). If CONSOLE_DEVICES isn't set in the config file, the new config param table defaults it to "mouse, console".

The code in sysapi includes a comment from 1999 saying we should ignore the kbdd if we can stat any console devices, but doesn't say why. It doesn't ignore the kbdd for KeyboardIdle. I propose that sysapi be changed to never ignore the kbdd for console activity.

Also, the documentation for the kbdd needs to be updated. It says that the kbdd is only useful on Digital Unix.
